thread.title: Hunter Pence’s final thoughts on 2015 Giants
thread.title_full: Hunter Pence’s final thoughts on 2015 Giants - San Francisco Chronicle

author: John Shea
title: Hunter Pence’s final thoughts on 2015 Giants
text:
Photo: John Bazemore, Associated Press San Francisco Giants catcher Buster Posey, left, and San Francisco Giants right fielder Hunter Pence celebrate after defeating the Atlanta Braves 6-1in a baseball game, Wednesday, Aug. 5, 2015, in Atlanta. (AP Photo/John Bazemore) San Francisco Giants catcher Buster Posey, left, and San Francisco...
Hunter Pence played just 52 games because of injuries, but his words remained valuable during a season that didn’t reach expectations because of a variety of reasons, including his own physical limitations. He was shelved with a broken forearm, wrist tendinitis and a strained oblique, the last ailment keeping him out since Aug. 17. Unlike some other injured players, Pence stayed with the club home and away and helped tutor and motivate his teammates, especially the ones called up from the minors to replace all the injured players. San Francisco Giants catcher Buster Posey, left, and San Francisco Giants right fielder Hunter Pence celebrate after defeating the Atlanta Braves 6-1in a baseball game, Wednesday, Aug. 5, 2015, in Atlanta. (AP Photo/John Bazemore) San Francisco Giants catcher Buster Posey, left, and San Francisco...
Hunter Pence played just 52 games because of injuries, but his words remained valuable during a season that didn’t reach expectations because of a variety of reasons, including his own physical limitations. He was shelved with a broken forearm, wrist tendinitis and a strained oblique, the last ailment keeping him out since Aug. 17. Unlike some other injured players, Pence stayed with the club home and away and helped tutor and motivate his teammates, especially the ones called up from the minors to replace all the injured players.
